relationships.notes: Called Paul’s beloved child and coworker, entrusted with sensitive visits to Thessalonica, Corinth, and Ephesus to reinforce Paul’s teaching.
Works alongside Silas in Macedonia and appears with him as a co-author of the Thessalonian correspondence, sharing responsibility for pastoral follow-up.

traits.relationship_to_paul: close coworker and co-sender of several letters; addressed as 'our brother' and trusted representative.
traits.roles_and_tasks: sent as emissary to congregations to strengthen and report on their faith, especially in Thessalonica and Corinth.
traits.character_evaluation: depicted as genuinely concerned for the churches' welfare and exemplary in service, held up as a model of selfless ministry.
traits.social_location: moves within Paul's itinerant mission team alongside figures like Silvanus and other collaborators.

traits.origin_background: son of a Jewish woman who is a believer and a Greek father, from Lystra; already well spoken of by local believers when Paul meets him.
traits.relationship_to_paul: joins Paul's mission as a junior coworker and trusted traveling companion.
traits.ritual_practice: is circumcised by Paul 'because of the Jews' in those places, illustrating a pragmatic adaptation to Jewish sensibilities.
traits.mission_activity: accompanies Paul through regions such as Macedonia and Achaia and later appears among those traveling with him toward Jerusalem.

traits.relationship_to_paul: addressed as Paul's 'true child' in the faith, with a pronounced mentor–disciple tone.
traits.ecclesial_role: portrayed as a delegate left in charge of communities (notably in Ephesus) to oppose false teaching and appoint leaders.
traits.character_exhortation: urged to guard the entrusted teaching, to model sound doctrine and moral integrity, and to endure suffering in ministry.
traits.church_order_focus: functions within a setting of developed church structures and household norms, reflecting a more institutionalized community than in the undisputed letters.
